result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Willie L. Hopson in court with attorney Andrew I Martinez.  Defendant Willie L. Hopson in custody.  Sue M Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court request to hear victim, M.H.'s motion first.  Court calls M.H., sworn & testifies as to incident and her request to have bond modified.  State questions victim.  Attorney Martinez's addresses motion.  No recent warrant history.  Cash bond posted on a prior case which is pending.  Request bond be amended to signature bond.   State request bond remain at cash and remain with a no contact w/ victim.  Attorney Martinez argues bond.  State gives final statement.  Court denies motion to modify bond from cash to signature and partially grants motion to modify bond re: contact with victim.  Contact with victim, M.H. may be allowed at the Sauk County Jail.

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on April 11, 2014 at 09:15 am.

Defendant Willie L. Hopson by video from LEC with attorney Thomas L. Steinman.  Defendant Willie L. Hopson in custody.  Sue M. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives reading of complaint.  State requests cash bond.  Atty Steinman responds.  DE does qualify for PD appt.  Advised rights to an attorney.  Requests Preliminary hearing; Time limits not waived.  $1,500.00 cash bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows:  Absolute sobriety at all times from alcohol and controlled substances, not to possess/consume any controlled substances w/o a valid prescription and no contact w/M.H. or her residence or premises.  May go to residence one time upon prior notice and w/law enforcement to retrieve belongings. Defendant Willie L. Hopson in court with attorney Andrew I. Martinez.  Defendant Willie L. Hopson in custody.  Sue M. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 11, 2014 at 09:15 am.
